Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello

Class OthelloController

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloController
Direct Known Subclasses:
OthelloControllerHumanVSGreedy, OthelloControllerHumanVSHuman, OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom, OthelloControllerRandomVSGreedy, OthelloControllerRandomVSRandom
public abstract class OthelloController extends Object
The OthelloController is an abstract class containing all the basics for an Othello game. This class is used to play the Othello game, where the abstract method play() contains the logic for the game, including alternation turns and print out the game state reports.

      protected Othello othello

  • Constructor Details

    • OthelloController

      public OthelloController()
      Create an OthelloController. This consutrctor initialiizes the Othello game, which represents the state of the game.

  • Method Details

    • play

      public abstract void play()
      Play the Othellogame. This will involve making moves until the game is over.

    • reportMove

      protected void reportMove(char whosTurn, Move move)
      Print out the move that has just been made.
      Parameters:
      whosTurn - the player who made the move
      move - the move that was made

    • report

      protected void report()
      Report the current state of the board. This is used at the start and during the Othello game. The board state, number of tokens, and whose turn it is, is printed out.

    • reportFinal

      protected void reportFinal()
      Print out the final state of the board. This is used at the end of the Othello game. The board state, number of tokens, and whose turn it is, is printed out.
